column4: i believe i have filled up my entire sda5 where karmic is installed, and i want to completely free up space on that partition...
i tried "sudo apt-get autoremove && sudo apt-get clean" and it returned all 0s (meaning that there were no (unneeded) packages to clean i think)...
i also tried "du -sh.*" in the /home directory and got a bunch of "permission denied"
can anybody help please?
i have not tried 'rm' because i am not sure how to use it / where to use it
drpenguin: how do you suggest i free up space (i don't need ANY data on that sda5 partition)?
9.10 karmic
you could reformat the partition
is your system installed to sda5?
you could just reinstall if you have no data that you care about

if the deleted partitions (now free space) are contiguous you can reinstall with / at sda5 and /home in a new partition in the free space... there are advantages to keep / and /home on separate partitions
right now, if I understand, you have two Windows partitions, ubuntu on sda5, and a bunch of free space, right?
if you run "sudo parted" you can see what the partitioning looks like
parted is the command line version of gparted (disk manager)
yes
help gives you the list of commands and "print all" shows you the partitions
yes, absolutely
my pleasure and good luck
df will probably tell you what you want to know
i think so... try "df -a"
-a = --all
good luck
ouch!
